episodeTitle: A Collision! Law vs. Vice Admiral Smoker!
description: Law and Smoker engage in an intense battle outside the research facility on Punk Hazard. Meanwhile, Luffy's group rides on Brownbeard toward the mysterious laboratory, and Nami's team attempts to escape with kidnapped children while dealing with their body-swapped predicament.

events.title: Law vs. Smoker Battle Begins
events.description: Trafalgar Law and Vice Admiral Smoker engage in combat outside the research facility entrance. Smoker demands to know why Law is on Punk Hazard, while Law remains cryptic about his intentions.
events.significance: First major post-timeskip confrontation between Law and Smoker, showcasing Law's enhanced abilities as a Shichibukai and setting up the power dynamics of the Punk Hazard arc.

quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker expressing his suspicion about Law's presence on Punk Hazard

quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's cryptic response to Smoker's distrust

events.title: Monet Observes the Battle
events.description: Monet, Caesar's harpy assistant, watches the battle between Law and Smoker from above and reports the situation to her master.
events.significance: Introduces Monet as an observer and spy for Caesar Clown, establishing surveillance on the island.

events.title: Luffy's Group Rides Brownbeard
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, Robin, and Usopp ride on top of the defeated Brownbeard and his centaurs after stealing their warm coats, heading toward the mysterious building Brook told them about.
events.significance: Shows the Straw Hats progressing toward the research facility and their resourcefulness in the harsh Punk Hazard environment.

events.title: Body Swap Confusion
events.description: Nami's group (including Sanji in Nami's body, Nami in Franky's body, Chopper in Sanji's body, and Franky in Chopper's body) struggle with the body-swap predicament while trying to escape with the kidnapped children.
events.significance: Highlights the comedic and challenging consequences of Law's Room ability and body-switching powers, creating obstacles for the Straw Hats.

quotes.speaker: Child
quotes.context: Children questioning the strange behavior of their rescuers

events.title: Smoker Uses Sea Stone Jitte
events.description: Smoker wields his sea stone-tipped jitte weapon against Law, attempting to neutralize Law's Devil Fruit powers in close combat.
events.significance: Demonstrates Smoker's strategic approach to fighting Devil Fruit users and his enhanced combat skills after the timeskip.

events.title: Tashigi's Flashback
events.description: Tashigi recalls her previous encounters with Smoker and the Straw Hat Pirates, reflecting on her journey and growth as a Marine.
events.significance: Provides character development for Tashigi and reminds viewers of her ongoing rivalry with Zoro and dedication to Smoker.

events.title: Law Demonstrates Room Cutting Power
events.description: Law's attacks during the fight are so powerful that his recoils cut up everything in the surrounding area within his Room, demonstrating the devastating range and precision of his abilities.
events.significance: Showcases the true extent of Law's surgical manipulation powers and establishes him as a formidable Shichibukai-level combatant.

events.title: Law Uses Mes to Extract Smoker's Heart
events.description: Law uses his technique 'Mes' to extract Smoker's heart from his body, encasing it in a cube-like form. Despite Smoker's heart being removed, he remains alive but completely incapacitated.
events.significance: Introduces one of Law's most terrifying abilities - the power to remove and hold hearts hostage. This technique becomes crucial to the Punk Hazard arc's plot and demonstrates Law's tactical brilliance.

quotes.text: From your current standing, you couldn't see a few things.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's taunt before extracting Smoker's heart

events.title: Smoker Defeated by Law
events.description: With his heart removed from his body, Smoker collapses in defeat. Law stands victorious, holding Smoker's heart in his hand.
events.significance: Marks a significant defeat for Smoker and establishes Law as a major power player in the New World. This defeat has long-term consequences for Smoker's character arc.

quotes.text: I don't have to say anything to you, Smoker.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's final words before Smoker collapses

events.title: Caesar Learns of the Children's Escape
events.description: Caesar Clown becomes furious upon learning that the kidnapped children have escaped with Nami's group and that Smoker witnessed them.
events.significance: Reveals Caesar's desperate need to keep his experiments secret from the Marines and foreshadows the dark nature of his research on the children.

events.title: Luffy and Law's Post-Timeskip Reunion
events.description: At the end of the episode, Luffy arrives at the scene and is surprised to see Trafalgar Law, marking their first reunion since Sabaody Archipelago two years ago.
events.significance: Sets up the alliance between Luffy and Law that will become central to the next several arcs of One Piece.

quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Confronting Law about his presence on Punk Hazard

quotes.text: From your current standing, you couldn't see a few things.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Taunting Smoker before extracting his heart

quotes.text: I don't have to say anything to you, Smoker.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law

themes.description: The episode showcases how strategic thinking and unique abilities can overcome raw power, as Law's surgical precision defeats Smoker's aggressive combat style.
themes.symbolism: Law's ability to extract hearts symbolizes his control over life and death, and his strategic mind in achieving his goals.

themes.description: Smoker's distrust of the Shichibukai system is validated as Law reveals his true allegiance is not with the World Government.
themes.symbolism: The removal of Smoker's heart represents the loss of trust and the betrayal of the Shichibukai system.

themes.description: The body-swap subplot explores how our physical forms relate to our identity, as the Straw Hats struggle to adapt to their swapped bodies.
themes.symbolism: The body swaps represent the disruption of normal order and the chaos that Law's presence brings to Punk Hazard.

characterSpotlights.development: Law is established as a calculating and powerful Shichibukai with terrifying abilities. His cryptic motivations and alliance with Caesar are hinted at, building mystery around his true goals.
keyActions: Uses Mes technique to extract Smoker's heart
Reunites with Luffy at episode's end
quotes: From your current standing, you couldn't see a few things.
I don't have to say anything to you, Smoker.

characterSpotlights.development: Smoker demonstrates his enhanced post-timeskip abilities and tactical mind, but suffers a decisive defeat at Law's hands, marking a humbling moment in his pursuit of the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Confronts Law about his presence on Punk Hazard
Fights Law using sea stone jitte
Has his heart extracted by Law's Mes technique

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues his journey through Punk Hazard, showing his leadership and determination to reach the research facility.
keyActions: Rides on defeated Brownbeard toward the laboratory

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the fight sequence between Law and Smoker with additional combat choreography and visual effects that weren't present in the manga.
Tashigi's flashback sequences were added in the anime to provide additional context for her character development.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time Law's 'Mes' technique is shown in the anime, one of his most iconic and terrifying abilities.
Episode 587 adapts chapters 662 and 663 of the manga, specifically pages from both chapters.
The episode was directed by Naoyuki Itō and written by Yoshiyuki Suga, with art direction by Miho Shiraishi.
At the time of this episode's airing, the opening 'We Go!' had been used for 70+ episodes, making it one of the longest-running openings in One Piece history.
This episode does not have an ending theme song, as Toei Animation stopped producing ending themes from Episode 279 to Episode 1070.
